content.text: Another year went by and we improved our articles a lot. They are now longer, more detailed and 100% true.
I don't know what else to write as everything will be covered by the following articles.

McConnell, Pelosi and Biden: In US politics, the most powerful are almost all around 80 years old, and many Americans do not find their affairs represented by them. Only the old want to continue running - with good prospects.

Four years ago, a memorable dialogue erupted in the US Senate. Utah Senator Orrin Hatch, then 84 and who died in April of this year, asked 33-year-old Mark Zuckerberg about Facebook's business practices: 'How do you sustain a business model when customers aren't paying for your services?' Hatch, and Zuckerberg soberly replied, 'Senator, we sell ads.'
The short dialogue is often used when the question arises as to whether American politics urgently needs to be rejuvenated. America is a gerontocracy, they say, the country is ruled by old people.
Curious how the time-to-market can be reduced ten times?
